Hi all

I too was once an archaeologist working a lot in lincoln Uk where i=
 live now.
I worked on Lincoln castle, and while reopening the west gate in=
 1988 we
discovered the remains of the roman city boundry wall directly und=
erneath the
castle gate. We knew it was there as previous excavations had u=
nearthed one of
the roman gateways. 

it seems that the normans had used th=
e roman wall as part of the foundations.


I recently videoed a discovery c=
hannel program on the samurai and it had a lot
on Himeji castle. i forget t=
he weight of the wooden structure but the
foundations for the castle must b=
e amazing. Maybe that is one of the reasons
for the huge mound then to face=
 it with huge boulders. the more reienforcement
you have the more weight it=
 can take on top. It also seems Himeji has a wood

ide o fthe wood structure to stop it collapsing in

ke.
